sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

![Graph](https://i.imgur.com/LHz5n5n.png)

Identify how many cut vertices and bridges are there in the given graph?
message_2:
In the given graph, a cut vertex is a vertex that, when removed along with its incident edges, increases the number of connected components. A bridge is an edge that, when removed, increases the number of connected components.

Cut vertices:
1. Vertex A: Removing A and its incident edges disconnects vertex B from the rest of the graph.
2. Vertex C: Removing C and its incident edges disconnects vertex D from the rest of the graph.

There are 2 cut vertices in the graph.

Bridges:
1. Edge AC: Removing edge AC disconnects vertex D from the rest of the graph.
2. Edge AB: Removing edge AB disconnects vertex B from the rest of the graph.

There are 2 bridges in the graph.
